meanings.definition: (adj.) suitable for achieving a particular purpose
meanings.sent1: Using a map is expedient for finding your way in a new city.
meanings.sent2: Wearing a raincoat is expedient when it's raining outside.
meanings.sent3: It was expedient to bring an umbrella to the desert, just in case.
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking was as expedient as a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The flashlight proved to be expedient in the dark cave.

meanings.definition: (adv.) in a way that is convenient and practical
meanings.sent1: She packed her bag expediently before the trip.
meanings.sent2: He completed the task expediently to save time.
meanings.sent3: The cat moved expediently to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The chef chopped the vegetables expediently like a pro.
meanings.sent5: The student typed expediently to finish the assignment early.
